hackathon-description-text: Come one, come all! Hack with 300 other hackers from across the mid-Atlantic and build out your project you've been waiting to! Work with other developers, designers, and entrepreneurs to create a web, mobile, or hardware hack from scratch!
hackathon-eligibility: Teams can be anywhere from one to four people. If you are looking for teammates before the challenge, use ChallengePost's built in team-finding feature to find those who need your skills (or have the skills you want).
hackathon-requirements:
- Platforms: (iOS, Android, Web / Mobile Web, Mac, Windows, hardware hacks)
- Must include both submission and (screenshot or video)
- Must select which sponsorship prizes you are going for
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Newcomb Hall (Student Center), University of Virginia, Charlottesville, VA 22903, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack more than just another generic social app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well-designed?
Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Does it showcase technical talent? Is the depth of implementation within the 24 hour time limit impressive?

hackathon-location-address: Newcomb Hall (Student Center), University of Virginia, Charlottesville, VA 22903, USA
hackathon-description-header: Come for a Hack UVA good time!
